meanings.definition: A pair of fine lines or wires in the focus of the eyepiece of an optical instrument, used as a reference point in the field of view.
meanings.sent1: The sniper aimed through the crosshairs to hit the target accurately.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the camera's crosshairs to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: The detective's magnifying glass had tiny crosshairs that made everything look like a secret mission.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes locked onto the crosshairs of the microscope, exploring the hidden world of tiny organisms.
meanings.sent5: In the video game, the player's crosshairs followed the enemy, ready to strike at any moment.

meanings.definition: A point of focus or attention.
meanings.sent1: The speaker's words put the audience's thoughts in the crosshairs of understanding.
meanings.sent2: The missing key detail was now in the crosshairs of the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics always put the dangling toy in the crosshairs of its attention.
meanings.sent4: As the deadline approached, the project manager kept the final goal in the crosshairs of progress.
meanings.sent5: The bright spotlight put the singer's nervousness in the crosshairs of the audience's scrutiny.
